Key Arguments: The government should not have the authority to decide what is true or false.
Government agencies have a history of failing to identify the truth and have been involved in corruption and deceit.
The legislation treats adults like children and underestimates the intellectual capacity of the community.
The proposal is seen as a power grab that could harm society.
Notable Quotes: No one in The Australian Government has the right to decide for everyone else what is true or not.

Government agencies have not only consistently failed to identify the truth amongst the noise, but they’ve lied, forged data, hidden corruption, and proven their ineptitude to anyone with a brain who’s watching.
The actual truth will always win. My vote is that you put a stop to this power grab before you cause any further harm.
